svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
September 16, 2023" date: "2023-09-16"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
* Latest all core devs – execution (ACDE) call video . Recap by Tim Beiko . Notes from
Tim Beiko and Christine Kim : Testing continues on devnet-8 and MEV-Boost workflows on
kurtosis Max epoch churn limit (EIP7514) added to Dencun, the maximum new stakers per
epoch will be set to 8; Dankrad: EIP7514 gives time to deal with economic/tech
consequences of Lido attack BLOBBASEFEE opcode (EIP7516) for L2 fee calculations added
to Dencun EIP4788 (beacon block root in EVM) being updated with changes from audits
Devnet-9 to include EIP7514, EIP7516 & EIP4788 changes, ACDC to set launch date Reth
intro : EL client in Rust, hoping to join devnet-9
* Testing continues on devnet-8 and MEV-Boost workflows on kurtosis
Testing continues on devnet-8 and MEV-Boost workflows on kurtosis
* Max epoch churn limit (EIP7514) added to Dencun, the maximum new stakers per
consequences of Lido attack
Max epoch churn limit (EIP7514) added to Dencun, the maximum new stakers per epoch will
be set to 8; Dankrad: EIP7514 gives time to deal with economic/tech consequences of
Lido attack
* BLOBBASEFEE opcode (EIP7516) for L2 fee calculations added to Dencun
BLOBBASEFEE opcode (EIP7516) for L2 fee calculations added to Dencun
* EIP4788 (beacon block root in EVM) being updated with changes from audits
EIP4788 (beacon block root in EVM) being updated with changes from audits
* Devnet-9 to include EIP7514, EIP7516 & EIP4788 changes, ACDC to set launch date
Devnet-9 to include EIP7514, EIP7516 & EIP4788 changes, ACDC to set launch date
* Reth intro : EL client in Rust, hoping to join devnet-9
Reth intro : EL client in Rust, hoping to join devnet-9
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* 🚨 Lido at 32.3% has reduced slightly but still very close to breaching risky 33%
threshold
🚨 Lido at 32.3% has reduced slightly but still very close to breaching risky 33%
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth supermajority,
could possibly cause a chain split Consensus layer: Prysm over 33%, a bug could mean
loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
Execution layer: Geth supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
* Consensus layer: Prysm over 33%, a bug could mean loss of finality
Consensus layer: Prysm over 33%, a bug could mean loss of finality
* Need more geographic diversity for both stakers and nodes , particularly outside of
US/Can/EU
Need more geographic diversity for both stakers and nodes , particularly outside of
Layer 1
* Epoch churn limit increased from 11 to 12 (EIP7514 in Dencun sets to 8 for deposits)
Epoch churn limit increased from 11 to 12 (EIP7514 in Dencun sets to 8 for deposits)
* MEV-build-rs alpha : MEV-Boost builder in Rust, extends Reth (EL client)
MEV-build-rs alpha : MEV-Boost builder in Rust, extends Reth (EL client)
For Stakers
* Lodestar incentive program results, 86 validators to share $25k
Lodestar incentive program results, 86 validators to share $25k
* Geth node running on NanoPC-T6 ($129 board), synced in 13 hours
Geth node running on NanoPC-T6 ($129 board), synced in 13 hours
* Secure-signer (alpha): remote-signing inside hardware enclave
Secure-signer (alpha): remote-signing inside hardware enclave
* Tor Push : proof of concept for validator privacy, push messages into gossipsub via
Tor
Tor Push : proof of concept for validator privacy, push messages into gossipsub via Tor
Client releases
* Consensus layer: Nimbus v23.9.0 : Holešky testnet support and simplified config for
remote signers
Consensus layer:
* Nimbus v23.9.0 : Holešky testnet support and simplified config for remote signers
* Execution layer: Geth v1.13.0 : pruning reimplemented using path based storage (needs
a resync)
Execution layer:
* Geth v1.13.0 : pruning reimplemented using path based storage (needs a resync)
Research
* Streamlining fast finality : single proposal and voting phase per slot using strong
confirmation
Streamlining fast finality : single proposal and voting phase per slot using strong
* Two-tiered staking : native liquid staking design
Two-tiered staking : native liquid staking design
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs EIP7516 : BLOBBASEFEE opcode
EIPs
* EIP7516 : BLOBBASEFEE opcode
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7515 : NFT alternative text in metadata ERC7517 :
Content consent for AI/ML data mining ERC7518 : Global compliant STO & interoperable
asset lifecycle (ERC1155 extension)
ERCs (application layer):
* ERC7515 : NFT alternative text in metadata
ERC7515 : NFT alternative text in metadata
* ERC7517 : Content consent for AI/ML data mining
ERC7517 : Content consent for AI/ML data mining
* ERC7518 : Global compliant STO & interoperable asset lifecycle (ERC1155 extension)
ERC7518 : Global compliant STO & interoperable asset lifecycle (ERC1155 extension)
Stuff for developers
* Holešky testnet didn’t launch due to misconfiguration, relaunch expected in two weeks
Holešky testnet didn’t launch due to misconfiguration, relaunch expected in two weeks
* Hardhat v2.17.3 : default EVM set to Paris for solc v0.8.20+ (for L2s that don’t
support Shanghai)
Hardhat v2.17.3 : default EVM set to Paris for solc v0.8.20+ (for L2s that don’t
* Invariant check in modifier skipped if an assembly block directly returns
Invariant check in modifier skipped if an assembly block directly returns
* Overview of minimal proxies : ERC1167 variants and Clones with immutable arguments
Overview of minimal proxies : ERC1167 variants and Clones with immutable arguments
* ERC4626 conformance : 20% of vaults don’t conform
ERC4626 conformance : 20% of vaults don’t conform
* MinimalAccount (ERC4337): gas-optimized implementation in Huff for benchmarking
MinimalAccount (ERC4337): gas-optimized implementation in Huff for benchmarking
* ERC deployments : Dune dashboard showing number of deployments for common ERCs
ERC deployments : Dune dashboard showing number of deployments for common ERCs
* Huff-stack-generator : generate stack comments
Huff-stack-generator : generate stack comments
* Geas (Good Ethereum Assembler): macro assembler for the EVM
Geas (Good Ethereum Assembler): macro assembler for the EVM
* Slitherin (custom Slither detectors) v0.3 : adds arbitrary call detector
Slitherin (custom Slither detectors) v0.3 : adds arbitrary call detector
* Vyper compiler audit competition
Vyper compiler audit competition
* CTFs: ONLYPWNER : CTF platform with 9 challenges Curta CTF Murder Mystery writeup and
a solution Secureum RACE #21: 8 question Solidity quiz & answers
CTFs:
* ONLYPWNER : CTF platform with 9 challenges
ONLYPWNER : CTF platform with 9 challenges
* Curta CTF Murder Mystery writeup and a solution
Curta CTF Murder Mystery writeup and a solution
* Secureum RACE #21: 8 question Solidity quiz & answers
Secureum RACE #21: 8 question Solidity quiz & answers
* Paradigm’s Rust x Ethereum slides & videos : Reth, Foundry, Alloy, Ruint and
wagmi/viem & Rivet
Paradigm’s Rust x Ethereum slides & videos : Reth, Foundry, Alloy, Ruint and wagmi/viem
& Rivet
* ZK Face ID wallet (ERC4337) demo, uses WebAuthn and Halo2 proof
ZK Face ID wallet (ERC4337) demo, uses WebAuthn and Halo2 proof
Security
* Balancer postmortem of two Linear Pools vulnerabilities : $1M bounty paid for first
vulnerability and second vulnerability exploited for $1.2M on mainnet & Optimism
Balancer postmortem of two Linear Pools vulnerabilities : $1M bounty paid for first
* Browsing for bugs : finding a Premia vulnerability with $3M at risk, fixed with
bounty paid
Browsing for bugs : finding a Premia vulnerability with $3M at risk, fixed with bounty
paid
Ecosystem
* 1 year mergeversary 🐼, supply reduced by 300k ETH MEV-Boost : first year of
out-of-protocol PBS
1 year mergeversary 🐼, supply reduced by 300k ETH
* MEV-Boost : first year of out-of-protocol PBS
* ETHAccra hackathon projects
ETHAccra hackathon projects
Onchain stats
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 7 to 411 gwei, with 15.6 gwei average Negative
issuance currently at 20.6 gwei 3.9k ETH net issuance this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 7 to 411 gwei, with 15.6 gwei average
* Negative issuance currently at 20.6 gwei
Negative issuance currently at 20.6 gwei
* 3.9k ETH net issuance this week
3.9k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $1,541 - 1,653, currently $1642
ETHUSD : $1,541 - 1,653, currently $1642
* ETHBTC : currently 0.0616 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.0616 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
* MetaMask Snaps beta : wallet plugins for transaction security, chat & non-EVM
networks
MetaMask Snaps beta : wallet plugins for transaction security, chat & non-EVM networks
* Uniswap UI auto detects fee on transfer tokens
Uniswap UI auto detects fee on transfer tokens
* Gaslite : airdrop ETH, ERC20 & ERC721 tokens, including ETH to Friend Tech key
holders
Gaslite : airdrop ETH, ERC20 & ERC721 tokens, including ETH to Friend Tech key holders
* Optimism directly distributing unclaimed OP for Airdrop 1
Optimism directly distributing unclaimed OP for Airdrop 1
Job Listings
* Product Manager - L2 Blockchain Effort @ Status: All jobs
Product Manager - L2 Blockchain Effort @ Status: All jobs
* EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team seek a Technical Project Coordinator
EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team seek a Technical Project Coordinator
* Senior Operations Security Expert wanted by EF
Senior Operations Security Expert wanted by EF
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit). Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* SEC claims Stoner Cats NFTs are securities : $1 million fine, return sale proceeds &
destroy NFTs held by the team Unanimous Republican dissent from Commissioners Peirce &
Uyeda Jonathan Mann’s this song is a security NFT sold for 6 ETH
SEC claims Stoner Cats NFTs are securities : $1 million fine, return sale proceeds &
destroy NFTs held by the team
* Unanimous Republican dissent from Commissioners Peirce & Uyeda
Unanimous Republican dissent from Commissioners Peirce & Uyeda
* Jonathan Mann’s this song is a security NFT sold for 6 ETH
Jonathan Mann’s this song is a security NFT sold for 6 ETH
* DeFi Education Fund attempts to cancel a US patent claiming to invent oracles
DeFi Education Fund attempts to cancel a US patent claiming to invent oracles
* Three PayPal dollars : centralized, crypto & savings, with crypto offering better
protections than centralized but savings offers deposit insurance & interest
Three PayPal dollars : centralized, crypto & savings, with crypto offering better
* FTX allowed to sell its crypto assets
FTX allowed to sell its crypto assets
General
* Remove your phone number from Twitter (X) to prevent account recovery by sim swap
Remove your phone number from Twitter (X) to prevent account recovery by sim swap
* Pink Drainer targets users with most profitable attack: Seaport bulk listing
signature, setApprovalForAll, upgradeTo, transfer ETH and transferPunk
Pink Drainer targets users with most profitable attack: Seaport bulk listing
* ZachXBT refund for legal fee donations
ZachXBT refund for legal fee donations
* Centralized exchange hot wallet thefts: $54M from CoinEx & $2.7M from Remitano
Centralized exchange hot wallet thefts: $54M from CoinEx & $2.7M from Remitano
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the week’s news in real time.
Permalink for this week’s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-september-16-2023
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Sep 18-24 – ETHSafari (Kilifi Kenya)
Sep 18-24 – ETHSafari (Kilifi Kenya)
* Sep 21–24 – Pragma & ETHGlobal New York
Sep 21–24 – Pragma & ETHGlobal New York
* Oct 5-6 – ETHMilan conference
Oct 5-6 – ETHMilan conference
* Oct 6-27 – ETHOnline (ETHGlobal) virtual
Oct 6-27 – ETHOnline (ETHGlobal) virtual
* Oct 6-8 – ETHRome hackathon
Oct 6-8 – ETHRome hackathon
* Oct 13-15 – Ethereum Kuala Lumpur conference & hackathon
Oct 13-15 – Ethereum Kuala Lumpur conference & hackathon
* Oct 21 – Ethereum México
Oct 21 – Ethereum México
* Oct 22-24 – ETH Hong Kong
Oct 22-24 – ETH Hong Kong
* Oct 27-29 – ETH London hackathon
Oct 27-29 – ETH London hackathon
* Oct 27-29 – ETH Miami festival & hackathon
Oct 27-29 – ETH Miami festival & hackathon
* Oct 27-29 – ETH Vietnam
Oct 27-29 – ETH Vietnam
* Oct 28-30 – Paradigm CTF
Oct 28-30 – Paradigm CTF
* Oct 31 – Road to Devcon grants deadline (max $1k for local meetups)
Oct 31 – Road to Devcon grants deadline (max $1k for local meetups)
* Nov 3-5 – ETHBrno
Nov 3-5 – ETHBrno
* Nov 3-5 – ETH Lisbon hackathon
Nov 3-5 – ETH Lisbon hackathon
* Nov 13-19 – Devconnect (Istanbul)
Nov 13-19 – Devconnect (Istanbul)
* Nov 16-19 – Pragma & ETHGlobal Istanbul
Nov 16-19 – Pragma & ETHGlobal Istanbul
* Dec 4-5 – ETHVenice
Dec 4-5 – ETHVenice
* Dec 8-10 – ETHGlobal ETHIndia (Bangalore)
Dec 8-10 – ETHGlobal ETHIndia (Bangalore)
